sentences.english: Too many people live in a prison that they have themselves manufactured.
sentences.chinese: 太多的人自作牢笼，桎梏了自己。

sentences.english: It is a difficult and long-term task to break through the shackles of clan authority.
sentences.chinese: 要使壮族婚姻冲破族权的桎梏，任重而道远。

sentences.english: Superstition is a great shackle on men's minds.
sentences.chinese: 迷信是人们思想的一大桎梏。

sentences.english: Can't seem to loosen my grip On the past.
sentences.chinese: 似乎还是看不出，我已逃离过去的桎梏。

sentences.english: Be light-footed and free without the shackle, you can feel the passion of naivete.
sentences.chinese: 走出桎梏，一身的轻盈与自由，释放着纯真的热情。

sentences.english: The Japanese militarism has become the shackle of the relationship between China and Japan.
sentences.chinese: 日本军国主义已经成为中日两国关系发展中的桎梏。

sentences.english: She also appears to have a shackle on her left wrist.
sentences.chinese: 她看起来也对她的左手腕桎梏。

sentences.english: Just because a horse has new blinkers does not mean that the horse will run faster.
sentences.chinese: 正因为有新的桎梏一匹马，并不意味着将跑得快。

sentences.english: These bonds are shackle free, wrapped in lust and lunacy.
sentences.chinese: 这些没有束缚的桎梏，缠绕在淫欲和错乱中。

definition: cage/trap (e.g. basket, pit or snare for catching animals)/fig. bonds (of wrong ideas)/shackles (of past misconceptions)/to trap/to shackle
to stand aloof/to be detached from/to transcend worldliness/untrammeled/unconventional
to eliminate/to do away with/to get rid of
to separate oneself from/to break away from/diastasis (medicine)/abscission/abjunction (botany)
to break away/to extricate/to escape/to leave the confines of
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
lit. to be confined within a circle drawn on the ground (idiom)/fig. to confine oneself to a restricted range of activities
